attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFEMamfD4wETZ6SgTzQ_description
attribs.current: You have proficiency in the Perception skill. In addition, attacking at long range doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFEvym6AYWR-zPr-QcD_description
attribs.current: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 +your Dexterity modifier +your Wisdom modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFExiGzqn2rlb0C8hZ9_itemcontent
attribs.current: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFExiGzqn2rlb0C8hZ9_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFExs9ETxCt1Zju26yT_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a bedroll

• a mess kit

• a tinderbox

• 10 torches

• 10 days of rations

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFG97L32uMEf1JtH90G_itemcontent
attribs.current: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion.  The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFH4oHKzHVahHnqWja1_description
attribs.current:
You have trained extensively with specialized or particularly unique weapons. When you take this feat, gain proficiency with one exotic weapon of your choice.
Characters without this feat or its equivalent do not have access to the burst fire or special properties when using exotic weapons.

Holds 20 Bolts

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFH4oHKzHVahHnqWja1_name
attribs.current: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Repeating Crossbow, Heavy

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFH52jdV9kZOZEUzFHy_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in crossbows --which are your Kensai weapons and count as monk weapons for you.

You do not need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon, and you can ignore the loading property on crossbows. You can reload all weapons you are holding if you expend 10 feet of movement, or 20 feet of movement if you are holding a heavy weapon.

When making an unarmed strike as a bonus action granted by Martial Arts or Flurry of Blows, you can instead make an attack with your Kensai weapon. When doing so:

The damage dealt by the attack uses your Martial Arts die instead of its normal weapon damage
Your normal and long range are reduced by 1/3.
The attack does not trigger damaging effects that occur on a hit, such as hex or sneak attack.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFH5iLozFmlkS5sOSLk_description
attribs.current: Starting at 3rd level,you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 +your Dexterity modifier +your monk level. If you reduce the damage to O,you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free, If you catch a missile in this way,you can spend I ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFHE3B4zTXIjfCvNGKF_description
attribs.current: A weapon that has the burst fire property can make a normal single-target attack, or it can spray a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's normal damage. This action uses ten pieces of ammunition.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFHGh-ZLh9QdMaGVI4F_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFIDs4vALY-zg2OLwn4_itemcontent
attribs.current:
This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or other beneficial potion. However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. An identify spell reveals its true nature.

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage, and you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. At the start of each of your turns while you are poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage. At the end of each of your turns, you can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage decreases to 0.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: No more naps from Mr. Frugals - Will eat me

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFLDd27uq7DiZxNkBR5_description
attribs.current: Starting at 5th level,you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack. you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LFQkQgdFrH3UDs3yYz6_itemcontent
attribs.current: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision. wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFZukEhKnEmvJ06PI86_description
attribs.current:
At 6h level Your Kensai weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. You can apply your stunning strike feature on a ranged attack.

Your Kensai weapons are improvised melee monk weapons for you. You might extend hand crossbows' bolts to stab with, flip out a folding blade from your heavy crossbow, or use your bow as a club. A creature hit by a melee weapon attack using your Kensai weapon has disadvantage on opportunity attacks towards you until the start of your next turn.

Once per short rest, your melee attacks with your Kensai weapon are at advantage until the end of your turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFZbVDMW0XKBG5vEnN0_description
attribs.current: While not wielding a weapon in your offhand, you may attempt to blind an enemy with a bonus action attack. Make a dexterity attack roll with which you are proficient. On a hit, it does 0 damage and blinds the enemy until the end of your turn. You may use this ability A number of times equal to half your level rounded up, and a number of uses equal to a third of your level rounded down restore on a short rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFaUxbgZH4RzEZqZTlE_description
attribs.current: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LFaVUbMYCc9VhcnGF10_description
attribs.current: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect Yourself harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 +your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LGSxeA6fXhiWMNK3jW6_description
attribs.current: Starting at second level, on your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LImw3lzQUViUcOcPt6l_description
attribs.current:
You have mastered ranged weapons and can make shots that others find impossible. You gain the following benefits:

Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.
Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage
